00180 #define DSC_RMM416   11
00181 #define DSC_DMM32    12
00182 #define DSC_EMMDIO   13
00183 #define DSC_RMM1612  14
00184 #define DSC_DMMAT    15
00185 #define DSC_DMM16AT  16
00186 #define DSC_IR104    17
00187 #define DSC_EMM8         18
00188 #define DSC_PROM         19
00189 #define DSC_DALI     20
00190 #define DSC_OMMDIO       21
00191 #define DSC_DRVR     255

00201 #define UNIPOLAR        1

00204 #define GAIN_2          1

00206 #define GAIN_8          3

00277 /*///////////////
00278 // Error Codes //
00280 
00281 #define DE_NONE                                         0   /* no error  */
00282 #define DE_HW_FAILURE                           1   /* hardware failed */
00283 #define DE_SW_FAILURE                           2   /* software failed */
00284 #define DE_HW_NOT_SUPPORTED                     3   /* could not perform operation on this board  */
00285 #define DE_SW_NOT_SUPPORTED                     4   /* software does not yet support this operation */
00286 #define DE_INVALID_PARM                         5   /* a parameter to the function is invalid */
00287 #define DE_ALTERNATE_IN_PROGRESS        6   /* alternate interrupt function in progress */
00288 #define DE_NONE_IN_PROGRESS                     7   /* no interrupt function in progress to pause/cancel/resume */
00289 #define DE_BUFFER_ROLLOVER                      8   /* pointer passed in + sizeof data to be written would roll over a segment */
00290 #define DE_INVALID_ERROR_CODE       9   /* we used an invalid error code somewhere */
00291 #define DE_ALREADY_PAUSED                       10  /* can't pause an operation--it's already paused */
00292 #define DE_OVERFLOW                                     11  /* Am9513A counter function overflowed */
00293 #define DE_INVALID_FUNC                         12  /* Function number not recognized by board type */
00294 #define DE_DSCUDH_INVALID                       13  /* Header - Library version mismatch */
00295 #define DE_INVALID_BOARD                        14  /* Invalid board-type constant */
00296 #define DE_BOARD_LIMIT_REACHED          15  /* Tried to initialize too many boards at once */
00297 #define DE_BOARD_BUSY                           16  /* Attempt to acquire the board timed out */
00298 #define DE_INVALID_WINDRVR_HANDLE       17  /* Windriver initialization failed */
00299 #define DE_INVALID_WINDRVR_VERSION      18  /* Windriver version conflict */
00300 #define DE_BAD_WINDRVR_BOARD_INIT       19  /* Windriver could not initialize the board */
00301 #define DE_OPERATION_TIMED_OUT          20  /* Operation timed out */
00302 #define DE_INVALID_WINDRVR_KP           21      /* Windriver kernel plugin initialization failed */
00303 #define DE_THREAD_FAILURE                       22      /* Windriver failed to initialize thread */
00304 #define DE_DALI_ERROR               23  /* DALI Error, must print out error string to see details */
00305 
00306 /*/////////////////
00307 // Error Strings //
00309 
00310 #define STR_DE_NONE                                             "NO ERRORS REPORTED"
00311 #define STR_DE_HW_FAILURE                               "HARDWARE FAILURE"
00312 #define STR_DE_SW_FAILURE                               "SOFTWARE FAILURE"
00313 #define STR_DE_HW_NOT_SUPPORTED                 "OPERATION NOT SUPPORTED BY HARDWARE"
00314 #define STR_DE_SW_NOT_SUPPORTED                 "OPERATION NOT SUPPORTED BY SOFTWARE"
00315 #define STR_DE_INVALID_PARM                             "INVALID PARAMETER"
00316 #define STR_DE_ALTERNATE_IN_PROGRESS    "ALTERNATE INTERRUPT OPERATION IN PROGRESS"
00317 #define STR_DE_NONE_IN_PROGRESS                 "NO INTERRUPT OPERATION IN PROGRESS"
00318 #define STR_DE_BUFFER_ROLLOVER                  "POINTER + SIZE OF DATA OVERRUN BUFFER"
00319 #define STR_DE_INVALID_ERROR_CODE       "INVALID ERROR CODE, PLEASE IGNORE"
00320 #define STR_DE_ALREADY_PAUSED                   "OPERATION ALREADY PAUSED"
00321 #define STR_DE_OVERFLOW                                 "AM9513A COUNTER FUNCTION OVERFLOWED OR BUFFER OVERFLOW"
00322 #define STR_DE_INVALID_FUNC                             "INVALID FUNCTION FOR SELECTED BOARD"
00323 #define STR_DE_DSCUDH_INVALID                   "LIBRARY HEADER VERSION MISMATCH"
00324 #define STR_DE_INVALID_BOARD                    "INVALID BOARD TYPE SPECIFIED"
00325 #define STR_DE_BOARD_LIMIT_REACHED              "MAXIMUM NUMBER OF BOARDS REACHED"
00326 #define STR_DE_BOARD_BUSY                               "ATTEMPT TO ACQUIRE BOARD TIMED OUT"
00327 #define STR_DE_INVALID_WINDRVR_HANDLE   "INVALID WINDRIVER HANDLE RETURNED"
00328 #define STR_DE_INVALID_WINDRVR_VERSION  "INVALID WINDRIVER VERSION"
00329 #define STR_DE_BAD_WINDRVR_BOARD_INIT   "WINDRIVER BOARD INITIALIZATION FAILURE"
00330 #define STR_DE_OPERATION_TIMED_OUT              "OPERATION TIMED OUT"
00331 #define STR_DE_INVALID_WINDRVR_KP               "KERNEL PLUGIN INITIALIZATION FAILURE"
00332 #define STR_DE_THREAD_FAILURE                   "THREAD INITIALIZATION FAILURE"
00333 #define STR_DE_DALI_STREAMING                   "DALI STREAMING OPERATION IN PROGRESS"
00334 #define STR_DE_DALI_NOT_STREAMING               "NO DALI STREAMING OPERATION IN PROGRESS"
00335 #define STR_DE_DALI_NOT_SUPPORTED               "DALI FUNCTIONS SUPPORTED IN WIN32 AND LINUX ONLY"

00346 /*/////////
00347 // DSCCB //
00349 
00350 typedef struct
00351 {
00352         /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00353         // These members are filled automatically by dscInitBoard //
00354         //    THE USER DOES NOT HAVE TO FILL THESE IN MANUALLY    //
00356         BYTE boardtype;     /* Contains the boardtype constant */
00357         DSCB boardnum;      /* The handle to the board */
00358         
00359         /*///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00360         // The user must fill in everything below that pertains to //
00361         // board before the call to dscInitBoard                   //
00363         WORD base_address;  /* Base address of the board */
00364         BYTE dma_level;     /* DMA level of the board */
00365         LONG clock_freq;    /* Clock frequency in hertz */
00366 
00367         /*////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00368         // Use int_level for boards with only one interrupt //
00370         BYTE int_level;     /* Interrupt level of the board */
00371 
00372         /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00373         // For boards that use all three interrupts, you must //
00374         // use these three variables, not int_level           //
00376         BYTE int_level1;    /* Interrupt levels for boards with */
00377         BYTE int_level2;    /* More than one interrupt */
00378         BYTE int_level3;
00379 
00380         /*////////////////////////////////////////////
00381         //      For DMM32 revision checking, FPGA code  //
00383         WORD fpga;
00384 
00385         /*////////////////
00386         // OMM specific //
00388         BYTE interruptConf;
00389         BYTE counterConf;
00390 
00391         /*///////////////////////////////
00392         // RMM416 and RMM1612 specific //
00394         BOOL RMM_external_trigger;  /* Enable/disable external trigger */
00395         BOOL RMM_mode_16bit;        /* Set D/A ports to 16-bit */
00396 
00397         /*////////////////
00398         // RMM specific //
00400         BOOL RMM_DAC_0_3_external_enable;  
00401         BOOL RMM_DAC_4_7_external_enable;
00402     BOOL RMM_external_trigger_c3;
00403     
00404         /*////////////////
00405         // SMM specific //
00407         BYTE SMM_AD_resolution;     /* 12 or 14 bit */
00408 
00409         /*/////////////////
00410         // EMM specific  //
00412         WORD EMM_IOAddr[8];         /* IO addresses for up to eight ports */
00413         WORD EMM_Interrupt[8];      /* Interrupts for up to eight ports */
00414 
00415         /*/////////////////
00416         // PROM specific //
00418         BYTE clkfrq0;          /* 0 = 10Mhz, 1 = 1MHz */
00419         BYTE clkfrq1;          /* 0 = 10Mhz, 1 = 100KHz */
00420         BYTE clksel1;          /* 0 = internal oscillator, frequency set by ckfrq1.  1 = external clock input CLK1 */
00421     
00422         /*/////////////////
00423         // DALI specific //
00425 
00426         char DALI_host[128];
00427         WORD DALI_port;
00428         char DALI_username[24];
00429         char DALI_password[24];
00430 
00431 } DSCCB;
00432 
00433 
00434 /*/////////////////
00435 // DSCADSETTINGS //
00437 
00438 typedef struct
00439 {
00440 
00441         BYTE current_channel; /* INPUT: Which channel to read AD samples from */ 
00442         BYTE gain;            /* INPUT: 0 = gain of 1, 1 = gain of 2, 2 = gain of 4, 3 = gain of 8 */
00443         BYTE range;           /* INPUT: 0 = 5V range, 1 = 10V range */
00444         BYTE polarity;        /* INPUT: 0 = bipolar, 1 = unipolar */
00445         BYTE load_cal;        /* INPUT: 0 = do not load calibration values, 1 = load */
00446         BYTE scan_interval;   /* For DMM32 only 
00447                                                          INPUT: 0 = 20 microsecond interval, 1 = 15 microsecond
00448                                                                         2 = 10 microsecond interval, 3 = 5 micronsecond*/       
00449 
00450 } DSCADSETTINGS;
00451 
00452 
00453 /*/////////////
00454 // DSCADSCAN //
00456 
00457 typedef struct
00458 {
00459 
00460         BYTE      low_channel;    /* INPUT: Low channel of the scan */
00461         BYTE      high_channel;   /* INPUT: High channel of the scan */
00462         DSCSAMPLE *sample_values; /* I/O:   The user must point this to memory that has been allocated and ready to accept (high - low + 1) DSCADSAMPLE values into it */
00463         BYTE      gain;           /* Obsolete */
00464 
00465 } DSCADSCAN;

00486 
00487 typedef struct
00488 {

00495 
00496 /*/////////////
00497 // DSCAIOINT //
00499 
00500 typedef struct
00501 {
00502 
00503         DWORD num_conversions;      /* INPUT: total # of conversions to write to sample_values, unless cycling. */
00504         FLOAT conversion_rate;      /* INPUT: interrupts per second  */
00505         BOOL  cycle;                /* INPUT: when done with num_conversions, restart at the beginning of the buffer?  */
00506         BOOL  internal_clock;       /* INPUT: use the internal clock (82c54) ? */
00507         BYTE  low_channel;          /* INPUT: lowest channel number to perform A/D conversion on  */
00508         BYTE  high_channel;         /* INPUT: highest channel number to perform A/D conversion on  */
00509         BOOL  external_gate_enable; /* INPUT: A/D dmm, dmm-16 only  */
00510         BOOL  internal_clock_gate;  /* INPUT: Set internal gating on or off (refer to manual) */
00511         WORD  *sample_values;       /* I/O:   pointer to the user's sample buffer */
00512         BOOL  fifo_enab;            /* INPUT: Fifo operation flag for int sample/scan modes. */
00513         WORD  fifo_depth;           /* INPUT: Fifo depth (if fifo mode used) */
00514         DWORD dump_threshold;           /* INPUT: Threshold at which to dump the sample buffer */
00515         BOOL  channel_align;        /* INPUT: if true, the interrupt will automatically realign the channels each cycle */
00516         BYTE  clksource;                        /* INPUT: 0 for 100KHz, 1 for 10MHz internal clock source.*/
00517 
00518 } DSCAIOINT;
00519 
00520 
00521 /*//////////////////////////////
00522 // DSCAUTOCAL, DSCADCALPARAMS //
00524 
00525 typedef struct
00526 {
00527 
00528         BYTE   adrange;             /* INPUT:  A/D Range to calibrate (use 0xFF for all ranges) */
00529         BYTE   boot_adrange;        /* INPUT:  When cal'ed, this adrange is stored to BOOT values */
00530         FLOAT  ad_offset, ad_gain;  /* OUTPUT: Difference between target and measured vals. */
00531         DFLOAT target_values[8];    /* OUTPUT: Target values read from EEPROM */
00532 
00533         BOOL   use_eeprom;          /* Obsolete, but kept in for backwards compatibility */
00534                                     /* To set the reference values, use dsc(S/G)etReferenceVoltages */
00535         
00536 } DSCAUTOCAL, DSCADCALPARAMS;
00537

00559 {
00560 
00561         BOOL channel_enable[16]; /* INPUT: Which to update.  channel_enable[x] = 1 means that output_codes[x] is valid */
00562         DSCDACODE *output_codes; /* INPUT: A pointer to the user's array of DA codes */

00579 
00580 /*//////////////////
00581 // DSCDACALPARAMS //
00583 
00584 typedef struct   
00585 {
00586         
00587         BOOL   fixed;       /* OUTPUT: reports the "fixed" status that was detected.  fixed=FALSE means programmable. */
00588         BOOL   polarity;    /* OUTPUT: Bipolar=FALSE, Unipolar=TRUE */
00589         DFLOAT darange;     /* INPUT:  D/A range to calibrate */
00590         FLOAT  offset;      /* OUTPUT: Difference between target and measured vals. */
00591         FLOAT  gain;        /* OUTPUT: Difference between target and measured vals. */
00592         
00593         /*///////////////////////////
00594         // For DMMAT specific use: //
00596         BOOL  ch0pol, ch0prog, ch0ext;  /* cho0pol=true: bipolar, ch0prog=true: programmable, ch0ext=true: external; */
00597         BOOL  ch1pol, ch1prog, ch1ext;
00598         FLOAT ref;
00599 
00600 } DSCDACALPARAMS; /* Single D/A channel */
00601 
00602 
00603 /*////////
00604 // DSCS //
00606 
00607 typedef struct
00608 {
00609 
00610         BYTE  op_type;         // OUTPUT: reports the current operation type.  Will usually be either OP_TYPE_NONE or OP_TYPE_INT
00611         DWORD transfers;       // OUTPUT: the number of transfers the operation has performed in the current cycle
00612         DWORD total_transfers; // OUTPUT: the total number of transfers performed during every cycle    
00613         DWORD overflows;       // OUTPUT: increments this value each time an overflow occurs
00614         BYTE  paused;          // OUTPUT: true (1) if the current interrupt operation is paused.  false (0) otherwise
00615 
00616         /* The following are for backwards compatibility, not used anymore */
00617         BYTE  output;
00618         WORD  base_address;
00619         BYTE  int_level;
00620         BYTE  dma_level;
00621         BOOL  analog;   
00622 
00623 } DSCS;
00624 
00625 /*//////////////////////
00626 // DSCUSERINTFUNCTION //
00628 
00629 typedef struct
00630 {
00631 
00632         DSCUserInterruptFunction func; /* INPUT:  A pointer to the user's interrupt function */
00633         BYTE int_mode;                 /* INPUT:  Which user int mode to use */
00634 
00635 } DSCUSERINTFUNCTION;

00701 
00702 /*/////////////
00703 // DSCDIOINT //
00705 
00706 typedef struct
00707 {
00708 
00709         WORD num_transfers;   /* INPUT:  Number of conversions to perform */
00710         BYTE port;            /* INPUT:  for boards w/ >8 bits of dio */
00711         BYTE size;            /* INPUT:  0-7 for bits 0-7, 8 for full byte, 16 for word */
00712         BOOL cycle;           /* INPUT:  Set to TRUE to repeat the operation continuously */
00713         BOOL internal_clock;  /* INPUT:  Set to TRUE to use the internal clock as a trigger, FALSE to use an external trigger */
00714         BYTE mode;            /* INPUT:  for Garnet only */
00715         BYTE source;          /* INPUT:  for Onyx only */
00716         BYTE *digital_values; /* INPUT:  The array that holds the DIO values to send */
00717         DWORD dump_threshold; /* INPUT:  Threshold at which to dump the sample buffer */
00718 
00719 } DSCDIOINT;
00720 
00721 /*/////////////
00722 // DSCEMMDIO // this structure is for use with the EMMDIO function dscEMMDIO[G/S]etState 
00724 
00725 typedef struct 
00726 {
00727 
00728         BYTE DIOpins[6];           /* I/O:    contains values to write to pins, or values read from pins - based on use_DIOpins */
00729         BOOL lock_port[6];         /* INPUT:  values for the lock bits at base+7 */
00730         BYTE edge_polarity[3];     /* OUTPUT: contains the polarity to each pin on ports 0-2 (each BYTE is one port w/ 8 pins) 0=negative, 1=positive */
00731         BYTE edge_detect[3];       /* INPUT:  set edge detection enabled (1) or disabled (0) for the 8 pins on each port 0-2 */
00732         BYTE edge_detect_clear[3]; /* INPUT:  set to 1 for ech port 0-2 to clear the edge detection values */
00733         BYTE edge_detect_int[3];   /* OUTPUT: read-only: specifies if an edge was detected on the pin since its port was last cleared */
00734         BOOL use_DIOpins;          /* INPUT:  0 = ignore DIOpins, 1 = use DIOpins */
00735         BOOL use_lock_port;        /* INPUT:  0 = ignore lock_port, 1 = use lock_port */
00736         BOOL use_edge_polarity;    /* INPUT:  0 = ignore edge_polarity, 1 = use edge_polarity */
00737         BOOL use_edge_detect;      /* INPUT:  0 = ignore edge_detect, 1 = use edge_detect */    
00738         BYTE interrupt_status;     /* OUTPUT: read-only: corresponds to base+6, bits 0-2 are interrupt status for port 0-2 */
00739 
00740 } DSCEMMDIO;
00741 
00742 
00743 /*///////////////////
00744 // EMMDIOCLEAREDGE //
00746 
00747 typedef struct
00748 {
00749 
00750         BOOL use_lock_port;        /* INPUT:  0 = ignore lock_port, 1 = use lock_port */
00751         BOOL lock_port[6];         /* INPUT:  values for the lock bits at base+7 */
00752         BYTE edge_detect_clear[3]; /* INPUT:  set to 1 for ech port 0-2 to clear the edge detection values */
00753 
00754 } DSCEMMDIORESETINT;
00755 
00756 /*///////////////////
00757 // DSCDALISETTINGS // this structure for DALI channel settings
00759 
00760 enum { DALI_UNKNOWN, DALI_AIN, DALI_AOUT, DALI_DIN, DALI_DOUT, DALI_DANY };
00761 
00762 typedef struct
00763 {
00764         /* All output values */
00765 
00766         BYTE gain;       /* Gain for board associated with this DALI channel */
00767         BYTE range;      /* Range for board associated with this DALI channel */
00768         BYTE polarity;   /* Polarity for board associated with this DALI chanel */
00769         BYTE type;       /* DALI_AOUT, DALI_AIN, DALI_DOUT, DALI_DIN, DALI_DANY */
00770         BYTE board;      /* The board macro of the real remote PC/104 board */
00771         DWORD min;       /* Minimum engineering units possible on this channel */
00772         DWORD max;       /* Maxmimum engineering units possible on this channel */
00773         double vmin;     /* Minimum voltage units possible on this channel */
00774         double vmax;     /* Maximum voltage units possible on this channel */
00775 
00776 } DSCDALISETTINGS;
00777 
00778 
00779 /*///////////////
00780 // DSCWATCHDOG //
00782 
00783 typedef struct
00784 {
00785 
00786         WORD wd1;      /* INPUT: WD1 16-bit timer value (runs at ~32KHz - max 2 seconds) */
00787         BYTE wd2;      /* INPUT: WD2  8-bit timer value (runs at ~32KHz - max 7.2ms) */
00788         BYTE options;  /* INPUT: option mask (e.g. "PROM_WD_TRIGGER_SMI | PROM_WD_TRIGGER_NMI") */
00789         
00790 } DSCWATCHDOG;

00940 /* QMM counter group */
00941 #define QMM_COUNTER_GROUP_1             1
00942 #define QMM_COUNTER_GROUP_2             2
00943 
00944 /* QMM fout/counter source */
00945 #define QMM_SOURCE_E1_TC_NM1            0
00946 #define QMM_SOURCE_SRC1                 1
00947 #define QMM_SOURCE_SRC2                 2
00948 #define QMM_SOURCE_SRC3                 3
00949 #define QMM_SOURCE_SRC4                 4
00950 #define QMM_SOURCE_SRC5                 5
00951 #define QMM_SOURCE_GATE1                6
00952 #define QMM_SOURCE_GATE2                7
00953 #define QMM_SOURCE_GATE3                8
00954 #define QMM_SOURCE_GATE4                9
00955 #define QMM_SOURCE_GATE5                10
00956 #define QMM_SOURCE_F1_4MHZ              11
00957 #define QMM_SOURCE_F2_400KHZ            12
00958 #define QMM_SOURCE_F3_40KHZ             13
00959 #define QMM_SOURCE_F4_4KHZ              14
00960 #define QMM_SOURCE_F5_400HZ             15
00961 
00962 /* QMM time of day mode */
00963 #define QMM_TOD_DISABLED                0
00964 #define QMM_TOD_DIVIDE_BY_5             1
00965 #define QMM_TOD_DIVIDE_BY_6             2
00966 #define QMM_TOD_DIVIDE_BY_10            3
00967 
00968 /* QMM gating control */
00969 #define QMM_NO_GATING                   0
00970 #define QMM_ACTIVE_HIGH_TC_NM1          1
00971 #define QMM_ACTIVE_HIGH_LEVEL_GATE_NP1  2
00972 #define QMM_ACTIVE_HIGH_LEVEL_GATE_NM1  3
00973 #define QMM_ACTIVE_HIGH_LEVEL_GATE_N    4
00974 #define QMM_ACTIVE_LOW_LEVEL_GATE_N     5
00975 #define QMM_ACTIVE_HIGH_EDGE_GATE_N     6
00976 #define QMM_ACTIVE_LOW_EDGE_GATE_N      7
00977 
00978 /* QMM output control */
00979 #define QMM_INACTIVE_OUTPUT_LOW         0
00980 #define QMM_ACTIVE_HIGH_PULSE_ON_TC     1
00981 #define QMM_TOGGLE_ON_TC                2
00982 #define QMM_INACTIVE_OUTPUT_HIGH        4
00983 #define QMM_ACTIVE_LOW_PULSE_ON_TC      5
00984 
00985 /* QMM counter actions */
00986 #define QMM_ACTION_NONE                 0
00987 #define QMM_ACTION_ARM                  1
00988 #define QMM_ACTION_LOAD                 2
00989 #define QMM_ACTION_LOAD_AND_ARM         3
00990 #define QMM_ACTION_DISARM_AND_SAVE      4
00991 #define QMM_ACTION_SAVE                 5
00992 #define QMM_ACTION_DISARM               6
00993 
00994 /* QMM special counter actions */
00995 #define QMM_SPECIAL_CLEAR_TOGGLE_OUTPUT 0
00996 #define QMM_SPECIAL_SET_TOGGLE_OUTPUT   1
00997 #define QMM_SPECIAL_STEP_COUNTER        2
00998 #define QMM_SPECIAL_PROGRAM_ALARM       3
00999 
01000 /* QMM frequency intervals */
01001 #define QMM_INTERVAL_1MS_1KHZ           0
01002 #define QMM_INTERVAL_10MS_100HZ         1
01003 #define QMM_INTERVAL_100MS_10HZ         2
01004 #define QMM_INTERVAL_1S_1HZ             3
01005 #define QMM_INTERVAL_10S_01HZ           4
01006 
01007 /* QMM master mode register */
01008 typedef struct
01009 {
01010 
01011         BYTE counter_group;
01012         BYTE fout_divider;
01013         BYTE fout_source;
01014         BYTE compare1_enable;
01015         BYTE compare2_enable;
01016         BYTE tod_mode;
01017 
01018 } DSCQMM_MMR;
01019 
01020 /* QMM counter mode register */
01021 typedef struct
01022 {
01023 
01024         BYTE counter;
01025         BYTE gating_control;
01026         BYTE active_source_edge;
01027         BYTE count_source;
01028         BYTE special_gate;
01029         BYTE reload_source;
01030         BYTE cycle;
01031         BYTE count_type;
01032         BYTE count_direction;
01033         BYTE output_control;
01034 
01035 } DSCQMM_CMR;
01036 
01037 /* QMM multiple counter control */
01038 typedef struct
01039 {
01040 
01041         BYTE group1_action;
01042         BYTE group1_counter_select;
01043         BYTE group2_action;
01044         BYTE group2_counter_select;
01045         
01046 } DSCQMM_MCC;
01047 
01048 /* QMM special counter functions */
01049 typedef struct
01050 {
01051 
01052         BYTE counter;
01053         BYTE action;
01054         WORD alarm_value;
01055 
01056 } DSCQMM_SCF;
01057 
01058 /* QMM pulse width modulation control */
01059 typedef struct
01060 {
01061 
01062         BYTE  init;
01063         BYTE  counter;
01064         FLOAT output_freq;
01065         FLOAT duty_cycle;
01066         
01067         DWORD input_freq;
01068         WORD  load_reg;
01069         WORD  hold_reg; 
01070         BYTE  hit_extreme;
01071 
01072 } DSCQMM_PWM;
